text: Text Taken From Book or some other source
author: Naresh Chaurasia
book: Life As It Is, and what you want to MAKE of it.

comments.text: The thought that comes to my mind on reading this quote.

applications.text: What is my plan to work on this aspect of my life.

text: ‚úÖ He lacked self-confidence and, ever since childhood, this had been compounded by deep-seated feelings of inferiority with regard to his personal and academic backgrounds, as well as his physical appearance. Perhaps, as a result, he tended to be excessively self-conscious when people looked at him. Mostly, he seemed incapable of truly appreciating other people's happiness, and was constantly pitying himself. To him, the philosopher's claims were nothing more than the stuff of fantasy.
author: Ichiro Kishimi, Fumitake Koga

comments.text: I could not be big shot in my professional life. A disaster in personal life. Endless litigation. It killed my confidence. While the other factors from past were in play, now it is my age, my hair, my wrinkles

affirmations.text: What happened in past, you have not control over that. What you make of future is in your hand. You have all that you need to make your life meaningful. I have Money, Home, Job, Car, Brother, Sister, Good Health, Dance. Just keep going and make the best out of your life.
The Confidence. I love to Dance. The next goal of your dance is to make it to stage and make shines videos. If I do this, it will make me happy, and make life meaningful.

applications.text: Applied this by focusing on my current dance skills and creating content instead of waiting for perfection.

text: PHILOSOPHER: He is not pretending to be sick. The anxiety and fear your friend is feeling are real. On occasion, he might also suffer from migraines and violent stomach cramps. However, these too are symptoms that he has created in order to achieve the goal of not going out.
author: Ichiro Kishimi, Fumitake Koga

comments.text: I have create IMAGINARY symptoms to not take exams, go on stage, make videos, etc. The symptoms are I am NOT READY, they will NOT LIKE me etc. I don't have the looks, age, height, hair etc.

affirmations.text: STOP seekig validation. Just go out and do. Take one thing at a time, prioritize it, and get started with it.

applications.text: Started going to dance classes without overthinking what others think of my age or appearance.

text: PHILOSOPHER: Yes. Adlerian psychology is a psychology of courage. Your unhappiness cannot be blamed on your past or your environment. And it isn't that you lack competence. You just lack courage. One might say you are lacking in the courage to be happy.
author: Ichiro Kishimi, Fumitake Koga

comments.text: It is preventing me to change better and higher paying job. It is preventing me from getting into meaningful relationship. It is preventing me from taking certification exams. It is preventing me from getting onto stage. It is holding me back from content creation.

affirmations.text: OK. You can keep working in improving your competency. While you are working on it, keep using the current competency and make the best of it.

applications.text: Applied for a better job opportunity despite feeling I wasn't fully ready - focusing on courage over competence.

text: No! It's actually that he wants to leave the possibility of 'I can do it if I try' open, by not committing to anything. He doesn't want to expose his work to criticism, and he certainly doesn't want to face the reality that he might produce an inferior piece of writing and face rejection. He wants to live inside that realm of possibilities, where he can say that he could do it if he only had the time, or that he could write if he just had the proper environment, and that he really does have the talent for it. In another five or ten years, he will probably start using other excuses like 'I'm not young anymore' or 'I've got a family to think about now.'
author: Ichiro Kishimi, Fumitake Koga

comments.text: Yes. I am afraid of criticis, feedback and failure. I did not have pleasant experience in the past. So whenever there is possibility of getting feedback, I run away, as I don't want to expose myself, don't want to expose my flaws

affirmations.text: More than you skill or competency, it is about your ability to deal with people. If you want to grow in life, you have to work on your people skill.

applications.text: Started sharing my dance videos publicly despite fear of criticism, focusing on connection over perfection.

text: PHILOSOPHER: Just like the young woman with the fear of blushing, who was afraid of being rejected by the man, you are afraid of being negated by other people. You're afraid of being treated disparagingly; being refused, and sustaining deep mental wounds. You think that instead of getting entangled in such situations, it would be better if you just didn't have relations with anyone in the first place. In other words, your goal is to not get hurt in your relationships with other people
author: Albert Einstein
book: The World As I See It

comments.text: Yes. I am trying to avoid emotional wounds, and therefore I am avoiding relationships with others.
I am trying to avoid people becaue of my short coming in terms of AGE | HEIGHT | HAIR etc.

affirmations.text: Try to build trust and relationship, instead of chasing flick. If flick happens, it is a bonus.

applications.text: Focus on building genuine connections in dance community rather than seeking validation from strangers.

text: üìå Why do you dislike yourself? Why do you focus only on your shortcomings, and why have you decided to not start liking yourself? It's because you are overly afraid of being disliked by other people and getting hurt in your interpersonal relationships
author: Ichiro Kishimi, Fumitake Koga

comments.text: When you dislike yourself, even a little, it gives your mind an excuse to stay distant from others. You think: I'm not that interesting / worthy / likable.‚Äù So you don't fully show yourself, don't take social risks, don't open up emotionally. By keeping this distance, you protect yourself from potential rejection, criticism, or hurt. In short: self-dislike becomes a shield ‚Äî it justifies staying away, so you feel safe from emotional pain. It's not about truth; it's about self-protection.
I always think like that. Let me go away for now | avoid social interations etc., and once I get better at whatever I am doing, and then I will come back.

affirmations.text: There are somethings in life which I CANNOT control and change. Let me stop worrying about that. I will keep working on the things which I can control. While I am working on it, I will keep positive attitue and keep trying.

applications.text: Let me make buckets.| ATTRACTION-DANCE | ATTRACTION | DANCE | MATURITY |. Attraction and Dance, the looks, the curves etc., is going to be my natural calling. But I have to start networking with Mature people. They will help me to grow professionally and personally.
